description: A story of how an architect and a serial killer were linked by the Chicago World's Fair of 1893. Originally published in 2003.
title: THE DEVIL IN THE WHITE CITY
author: Erik Larson

description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient's memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death. Originally published in 2014.
title: JUST MERCY
author: Bryan Stevenson

description: The story of a South Florida financier convicted of soliciting sex from underage girls.
title: FILTHY RICH
author: James Patterson and John Connolly with Tim Malloy

description: A collection of articles and speeches by the Supreme Court justice.
title: MY OWN WORDS
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg with Mary Hartnett and Wendy W. Williams

description: A celebration of the life and career of the Supreme Court justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
title: NOTORIOUS RBG
author: Irin Carmon and Shana Knizhnik

description: The hunt for America's first serial killer in Austin, Tex., in 1885.
title: THE MIDNIGHT ASSASSIN
author: Skip Hollandsworth

description: A friend of Adnan Syed, whose murder case was the focus of the popular podcast “Serial,” maintains his innocence.
title: ADNAN'S STORY
author: Rabia Chaudry

description: A memoir about a year in a women’s prison; the basis for the Netflix series. Originally published in 2010.
title: ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK
author: Piper Kerman

description: A successful American hedge fund manager in Russia was expelled by kleptocrats who then seized his property.
title: RED NOTICE
author: Bill Browder

description: The contrasting careers of the Supreme Court justices Sandra Day O'Connor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
title: SISTERS IN LAW
author: Linda Hirshman
